summary: "The Love Boat," an American TV series that aired from 1977 to 1986, was about the romantic and humorous adventures of passengers and crew on the cruise ship MS Pacific Princess. Led by Captain Merrill Stubing, played by Gavin MacLeod, the show was part of ABC's popular Saturday-night lineup. Though nominated multiple times, it never won a Golden Globe. The show's popularity led to TV movies and specials even after its end.
title: The Love Boat
